description: A delicious family recipe for homemade cinnamon apple rolls, perfect for a cold autumn afternoon.
ingredients: [{"name": "milk", "units": "cup", "amount": 1}, {"name": "yeast", "units": "packet", "amount": 1}, {"name": "eggs", "units": null, "amount": 2}, {"name": "sugar", "units": "cup", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "butter", "units": "tablespoons", "amount": 2}, {"name": "salt", "units": null, "amount": null}, {"name": "all-purpose flour", "units": "cups", "amount": 4.5}, {"name": "apples", "units": null, "amount": 2}, {"name": "brown sugar", "units": "cup", "amount": 1}, {"name": "ground cinnamon", "units": "teaspoons", "amount": 3}, {"name": "butter", "units": "tablespoons", "amount": 2}]
instructions: 1. In a small bowl, mix warm milk with yeast and let it rest for about 15 minutes. 2. In a large bowl, mix eggs, melted butter, sugar, and a pinch of salt. 3. Add the milk and yeast mixture and mix until combined. 4. Gradually add flour, mixing until smooth. 5. Knead for about 5 minutes. 6. Form a ball with the dough and place it in an oiled bowl. Cover and let rise for 1 hour. 7. Mix brown sugar and cinnamon. 8. Roll out the dough into a rectangle. 9. Brush with butter and sprinkle with the sugar-cinnamon mixture. 10. Peel and dice apples, add to the dough. 11. Roll the dough and refrigerate for 15 minutes. 12. Cut into 12 pieces. 13. Place in a baking dish and let rise for 30 minutes. 14. Preheat oven to 180ÂºC and bake for 20-25 minutes. 15. Cool on a rack and optionally sprinkle with icing sugar.
notes: You can prepare a vanilla glaze by mixing one cup of sugar with two tablespoons of vanilla essence.
